justification: High damage potential from credential theft, moderate reproducibility due to network exposure, medium exploitability requiring social engineering.
recommendations: Implement HTTPS with certificate pinning; Enforce multi-factor authentication; Add frontend-to-backend mutual TLS

justification: High damage potential for infrastructure compromise, high reproducibility through network interception, medium exploitability requiring data interception.
recommendations: Implement TLS 1.3 with perfect forward secrecy; Add message integrity checks (HMAC); Segment deployment service network

justification: High damage potential for data exposure, medium reproducibility through database vulnerabilities, high impact scope for all users.
recommendations: Encrypt sensitive data at rest; Implement row-level access controls; Enable audit logging for database access

threat_title: Denial of Service via Resource Exhaustion
justification: High damage potential for service disruption, high reproducibility through automated attacks, medium exploitability requiring resource allocation.
recommendations: Implement rate limiting with sliding window; Add circuit breaker patterns; Monitor for abnormal request patterns

threat_title: Elevation of Privilege via Compromised Session Tokens
justification: High damage potential for backend access, moderate reproducibility through token interception, medium exploitability requiring token reuse.
recommendations: Use short-lived tokens with OAuth 2.0; Implement token revocation mechanisms; Add anti-CSRF protections

threat_title: Input Validation Flaws Leading to Injection Attacks
justification: High damage potential for data corruption/compromise, high reproducibility through common attack vectors, low exploitability requiring precise input.
recommendations: Implement strict input validation; Use parameterized queries for database access; Sanitize all user inputs
